paper_abstract: We study the Kolmogorov complexity of a Binary Insertion Tree, and present a succinct encoding scheme for Binary Insertion Trees produced from incompressible permutations. Based on the encoding scheme, we obtain a simple incompressibility argument that yields an asymptotic analysis of the average height of a Binary Insertion Tree. This argument further implies that the QuickSort algorithm sorts a permutation of n elements in Theta (n lg n) comparisons on average. (C) 2007 Elsevier B.V. All rights reserved.
paper_title: Average-case analysis of QuickSort and binary insertion tree height using incompressibility
